sen.j: 斯波 氏経（しば うじつね、生没年不詳）は南北朝時代 (日本)の斯波氏の人物。
sen.e: Ujitsune SHIBA (years of birth and death, not known) was a person who lived in the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties (Japan).
Ujitsune SHIBA (years of birth and death unknown) was a person who lived in the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties (Japan).
Ujitsune SHIBA (years of birth and death unknown) was a person who lived in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
He was the second son of Takatsune SHIBA.
He was the second son of Takatsune SHIBA.
He was the second son of Takatsune SHIBA.
He was Minbu no shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) and Sakyo no daibu (chief of Sakyoshiki government agency).
He was Minbu no shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) and Sakyo no daibu (chief of Sakyoshiki government agency).
He was Minbu no shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) and Sakyo no daibu (chief of Sakyoshiki government agency).
Yoshitaka SHIBA was his child
Yoshitaka SHIBA was his child
Yoshitaka SHIBA was his child
He was in the line of Sueno and Kore.
sen.cmt: 全体の文意、「末野」、「是」に意味が不明です。
sen.e: He was in the line of Sueno and Kore.
He is said to be the founder of the Sueno clan.
sen.cmt: ここでのオリジナル和文「末野・是より出る」は全体的に意味が分かりずらいと思います。wiki を参照すると、「末野氏の祖とされる」とありますので、こちらでも和文とともにそのように修正いたしました。

sen.e: Family line
Family line
Family line

sen.j: 源氏の一流、河内源氏の名門 足利氏の一門。
sen.e: A member of the Ashikaga clan, which was is a distinguished family from Kawachi-Genji which in turn is a line of the Minamoto clan
A member of the Ashikaga clan, which was was a distinguished family from Kawachi-Genji, which in turn was a line of the Minamoto clan
A member of the Ashikaga clan, which was a distinguished family from Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan), which in turn was a line of the Minamoto clan
sen.cmt: 河内源氏→Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan) としました。

sen.j: 尾張流足利家の嫡流にあたる。
sen.e: It was the direct descendant of the Ashikaga family of Owari line.
It was the direct descendant of the Ashikaga family of Owari line.
It was the direct descendant of the Ashikaga family of Owari line.

sen.j: 斯波氏を名乗るのは高祖父 家氏とも父 高経ともいう。
sen.e: It is told that the family name "Shiba" began from the great-great-grandfather, Ieuji or the father, Takatsune.
It is told that the family name "Shiba" began from the great-great-grandfather, Ieuji or the father, Takatsune.
It is told that the family name "Shiba" began from the great-great-grandfather, Ieuji or the father, Takatsune.
He became Sankanrei Hitto (the head of three kanrei (shogunal deputy)).
He became Sankanrei Hitto (the head of three kanrei (shogunal deputy)).
He became Sankanrei Hitto (the head of three kanrei (shogunal deputy)).

sen.j: (詳細は斯波氏の項を見よ)兄には斯波家長、弟に管領 斯波義将、叔父には奥州斯波氏の祖となる斯波家兼らがいる。
sen.e: (For more information, refer to the section "Shiba clan.) He had a elder brother, Ienaga SHIBA, a younger brother, Yoshimasa SHIBA, who was kanrei, and an uncle, Iekane SHIBA, who became the founder of the Oshu Shiba clan.

(For more information, refer to the section "Shiba clan.) He had an elder brother, Ienaga SHIBA, a younger brother, Yoshimasa SHIBA, who was kanrei, and an uncle, Iekane SHIBA, who became the founder of the Oshu Shiba clan.

sen.j: 源義家－源義国－源義康－足利義兼－足利義氏 (足利家3代目当主)－足利泰氏－斯波家氏－斯波宗家－斯波家貞－斯波高経－斯波氏経
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshie - MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni - MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu - Yoshikane ASHIKAGA - Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (the third family head of Ashikaga family) - Yasuuji ASHIKAGA - Ieuji SHIBA - Muneie SHIBA - Iesada SHIBA - Takatsune SHIBA - Ujitsune SHIBA

MINAMOTO no Yoshie - MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni - MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu - Yoshikane ASHIKAGA - Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (the third family head of the Ashikaga family) - Yasuuji ASHIKAGA - Ieuji SHIBA - Muneie SHIBA - Iesada SHIBA - Takatsune SHIBA - Ujitsune SHIBA

Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 懐良親王と菊池武光らの南朝軍が少弐氏や大友氏を打ち破り、東上しようとした為、幕府によって康安元年/正平 (日本)16年（1361年）に九州探題に任命され、九州に派遣された。
sen.e: As the army of the Southern Dynasty led by the Imperial Prince Kagenaga and Takemitsu KIKUCHI disposed of the Shoni clan and the Otomo clan and tried to go up to the east, he was appointed in 1361 by bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to Kyushu Tandai (the post of the chiefs of the shogunate in Kyushu) and dispatched to Kyushu.

As the army of the Southern Dynasty led by the Imperial Prince Kagenaga and Takemitsu KIKUCHI disposed of the Shoni clan and the Otomo clan and tried to go up to the east, he was appointed in 1361 by bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to Kyushu Tandai (the post of the chiefs of the shogunate in Kyushu) and dispatched to Kyushu.

As the army of the Southern Court led by the Imperial Prince Kagenaga and Takemitsu KIKUCHI disposed of the Shoni clan and the Otomo clan and tried to go up to the east, he was appointed in 1361 by bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) to Kyushu Tandai (the post of the chiefs of the shogunate in Kyushu) and dispatched to Kyushu.

sen.j: しかしその翌年10月、長者原の合戦で南朝 (日本)軍に敗れ、大内弘世を頼って周防国に退く。
sen.e: In October next year, however, he was defeated by the army of the Southern Dynasty (Japan) in the Battle of Chojabaru and made a retreat to Suo Province asking Hiroyo OUCHI for help.
In October the next year, however, he was defeated by the army of the Southern Dynasty (Japan) in the Battle of Chojabaru and made a retreat to Suo Province asking Hiroyo OUCHI for help.
In November of the next year, however, he was defeated by the army of the Southern Court (Japan) in the Battle of Chojabaru and made a retreat to Suo Province asking Hiroyo OUCHI for help.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。Dynasty→Court としました。

sen.j: そのまま帰洛し、貞治6年/正平22年（1367年）に出家、道栄と号し嵯峨 (京都市)に隠棲した。
sen.e: He returned straight back to Kyoto and, in 1367, he became a priest and took the pseudonym, Doei, and retired to Saga (Kyoto City).
He returned straight back to Kyoto and, in 1367, he became a priest and took the pseudonym, Doei, and retired to Saga (Kyoto City).
He returned straight back to Kyoto and, in 1367, he became a priest and took the pseudonym, Doei, and retired to Saga (Kyoto City).

sen.j: 和歌にも優れ、頓阿と親交があった。
sen.e: He was also good at waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) and had close connection with Tona.
He was also good at waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) and had close connection with Tona.
He was also good at waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) and had close connection with Tona.

sen.j: 「新千載和歌集」にも歌が6首入選している。
sen.e: Six waka made by him were adopted in "Shinsenzai Wakashu"("New Collection of a Thousand Years", 18th imperial poetic anthology).
Six waka that eh wrote were adopted in "Shinsenzai Wakashu"("New Collection of a Thousand Years", 18th imperial poetic anthology).
Six waka that he wrote were adopted in 'Shin Senzai Wakashu' (New Collection of a Thousand Years).
sen.cmt: eh→ he に修正しました。"→ ' としました。
